subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Norway, Australia, Brazil and host China reached the Women’s World Cup quarterfinals yesterday, completing the eight-team field.Norway hammered Ghana, 7-2, in Hangzhou. Australia rallied to tie Canada, 2-2, on an injury-time goal by Cheryl Salisbury. Australia needed only a tie to advance, and Canada needed a victory.China edged New Zealand, 2-0, in Group D, and Brazil, the only 3-0 team, defeated Denmark, 1-0.The top-ranked United States will face England tomorrow, and the defending champion, Germany, faces North Korea. On Sunday, Norway faces China, and Brazil plays Australia.
